item.title: AWS Lambda functions now scale 12 times faster when handling high-volume requests | Amazon Web Services
item.description: Now AWS Lambda scales up to 12 times faster. Each synchronously invoked Lambda function now scales by 1,000 concurrent executions every 10 seconds until the aggregate concurrency across all functions reaches the account’s concurrency limit. In addition, each function within an account now scales independently from each other, no matter how the functions are invoked. […]

item.description: Visual Studio 2022 17.9 Preview 3 introduces significant enhancements to the Code Search, also known as the All-In-One Search, feature. Other changes are related to Xcode 15.1 support, additions to Microsoft Teams toolkit and other bug fixes.

item.title: May I Borrow your IPv4?
item.description: With the rise of IPv4 costs, IPv6-only servers are becoming more popular in low end hosting world. In one occasion, I acquired an IPv6-only server, but wanted to have IPv4 on it. Somewhere else, I have a dual-stack IPv4+IPv6 server, idling away. Can I "borrow" the IPv4 of that dual-stack server, to use on the IPv6-only server? I tried several methods, and found a way to make this work.
